Lebesgue Integral
This file contains a formalization of the Lebesgue integral. It starts with simple functions and their integral, provides basic operations (addition, etc.), and proves the properties of their integral (semi-linearity, non-decreasingness). It then defines the integral of measurable functions, proves the approximation theorem, the properties of their integral (semi-linearity, non-decreasingness), the monotone convergence theorem, and Fatou's lemma. Finally, it proves the linearity properties of the integral, the dominated convergence theorem and Fubini's theorem.
Main reference:
  • Daniel Li, Int√©gration et applications, 2016
    {nnfun T >-> R} == type of non-negative functions {fimfun T >-> R} == type of functions with a finite image {sfun T >-> R} == type of simple functions {nnsfun T >-> R} == type of non-negative simple functions cst_nnsfun r == constant simple function nnsfun0 := cst_nnsfun 0 sintegral mu f == integral of the function f with the measure mu \int[mu](x in D) f x == integral of the measurable function f over the domain D with measure mu \int[mu]_x f x := \int[mu](x in setT) f x dyadic_itv n k == the interval ` [(k%:R * 2 ^- n), (k.+1%:R * 2 ^- n) [ approx D f == nondecreasing sequence of functions that approximates f over D using dyadic intervals Rintegral mu D f := fine (\int D f 'd mu). mu.-integrable D f == f is measurable over D and the integral of f w.r.t. D is < +oo ae_eq D f g == f is equal to g almost everywhere product_measure1 m1 m2 sf == product measure over T1 * T2, mi is a measure over Ti, sf is a proof that m2 is sigma-finite

Lemma fimfunM f g : f √ó g = f \* g :> (_ ‚Üí _).
Lemma fimfun1 : (1 : {fimfun aT >-> rT}) = cst 1 :> (_ ‚Üí _).
Lemma fimfun_prod I r (P : {pred I}) (f : I ‚Üí {fimfun aT >-> rT}) (x : aT) :
  (\sum_(i <- r | P i) f i) x = \sum_(i <- r | P i) f i x.
Lemma fimfunX f n : f ^+ n = (fun x ‚áí f x ^+ n) :> (_ ‚Üí _).

Lemma indic_fimfun_subproof X : @FiniteImage aT rT \1_X.

Lemma fimfunE T (R : ringType) (f : {fimfun T >-> R}) x :
  f x = \sum_(y <- fset_set (range f)) (y √ó \1_(f @^-1` [set y]) x).

    (s := fset_set (f @` setT)) :
  ‚àÄ x, f x = \sum_(i < #|`s|) (s`_i √ó \1_(f @^-1` [set s`_i]) x).

Lemma fctD (T : pointedType) (K : ringType) (f g : T ‚Üí K) : f + g = f \+ g.
Lemma fctN (T : pointedType) (K : ringType) (f : T ‚Üí K) : - f = \- f.
Lemma fctM (T : pointedType) (K : ringType) (f g : T ‚Üí K) : f √ó g = f \* g.

   k *: f = k \*: f.
Arguments cst _ _ _ _ /.

Lemma fset_set_comp (T1 : Type) (T2 T3 : choiceType) (D : set T1)
    (f : {fimfun T1 >-> T2}) (g : T2 ‚Üí T3) :
  fset_set [set (g \o f) x | x in D] =
  [fset g x | x in fset_set [set f x | x in D]]%fset.

Lemma preimage_nnfun0 T (R : realDomainType) (f : {nnfun T >-> R }) t :
  t < 0 ‚Üí f @^-1` [set t] = set0.

Lemma preimage_cst T (R : eqType) (x y : R) :
  @cst T _ x @^-1` [set y] = if x == y then setT else set0.

Lemma preimage_cstM T (R : realFieldType) (x y : R) (f : T ‚Üí R) :
  x != 0 ‚Üí (cst x \* f) @^-1` [set y] = f @^-1` [set y / x].

Lemma preimage_add T (R : numDomainType) (f g : T ‚Üí R) z :
  (f \+ g) @^-1` [set z] = \bigcup_(a in f @` setT)
    ((f @^-1` [set a]) `&` (g @^-1` [set z - a])).

Lemma indic_nnfun_subproof (D : set T) : @IsNonNegFun T R (\1_D).

Section nnsfun_bin.

End nnsfun_bin.

Section nnsfun_iter.
Variables (T : measurableType) (R : realType) (D : set T).
Variable f : {nnsfun T >-> R}^nat.

Definition sum_nnsfun n := \big[add_nnsfun/nnsfun0]_(i < n) f i.

Lemma sum_nnsfunE n t : sum_nnsfun n t = \sum_(i < n) (f i t).

Definition bigmax_nnsfun n := \big[max_nnsfun/nnsfun0]_(i < n) f i.

Lemma bigmax_nnsfunE n t : bigmax_nnsfun n t = \big[maxr/0]_(i < n) (f i t).

End nnsfun_iter.

Section nnsfun_cover.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.
Variables (T : measurableType) (R : realType) (f : {nnsfun T >-> R}).

Lemma nnsfun_cover :
  \big[setU/set0]_(i \in range f) (f @^-1` [set i]) = setT.

Lemma nnsfun_coverT :
  \big[setU/set0]_(i \in [set: R]) (f @^-1` [set i]) = setT.

End nnsfun_cover.

#[global] Hint Extern 0 (measurable (_ @^-1` [set _])) ‚áí
  solve [apply: measurable_sfunP] : core.

Lemma measurable_sfun_inP {aT : measurableType} {rT : realType}
   (f : {mfun aT >-> rT}) D (y : rT) :
  measurable D ‚Üí measurable (D `&` f @^-1` [set y]).

#[global] Hint Extern 0 (measurable (_ `&` _ @^-1` [set _])) ‚áí
  solve [apply: measurable_sfun_inP; assumption] : core.

#[global] Hint Extern 0 (finite_set _) ‚áí solve [apply: fimfunP] : core.

Section measure_fsbig.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.
Variables (T : measurableType) (R : realType) (m : {measure set T ‚Üí \bar R}).

Lemma measure_fsbig (I : choiceType) (A : set I) (F : I ‚Üí set T) :
  finite_set A ‚Üí
  (‚àÄ i, A i ‚Üí measurable (F i)) ‚Üí trivIset A F ‚Üí
  m (\big[setU/set0]_(i \in A) F i) = \sum_(i \in A) m (F i).

Lemma additive_nnsfunr (g f : {nnsfun T >-> R}) x :
  \sum_(i \in range g) m (f @^-1` [set x] `&` (g @^-1` [set i])) =
  m (f @^-1` [set x] `&` \big[setU/set0]_(i \in range g) (g @^-1` [set i])).

Lemma additive_nnsfunl (g f : {nnsfun T >-> R}) x :
  \sum_(i \in range g) m (g @^-1` [set i] `&` (f @^-1` [set x])) =
  m (\big[setU/set0]_(i \in range g) (g @^-1` [set i]) `&` f @^-1` [set x]).

End measure_fsbig.

Section mulem_ge0.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.

Let mulef_ge0 (R : realDomainType) x (f : R ‚Üí \bar R) :
  (‚àÄ x, 0 ‚â§ f x) ‚Üí ((x < 0)%R ‚Üí f x = 0) ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ x%:E √ó f x.

Lemma muleindic_ge0 T (R : realDomainType) (f : {nnfun T >-> R}) r z :
  0 ‚â§ r%:E √ó (\1_(f @^-1` [set r]) z)%:E.

Variables (T : measurableType) (R : realType) (mu : {measure set T ‚Üí \bar R}).

Lemma mulem_ge0 x (A : R ‚Üí set T) :
  ((x < 0)%R ‚Üí A x = set0) ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ x%:E √ó mu (A x).

Lemma nnfun_mulem_ge0 (f : {nnfun T >-> R}) x :
  0 ‚â§ x%:E √ó mu (f @^-1` [set x]).
End mulem_ge0.
Arguments mulem_ge0 {T R mu x} A.

Definition of Simple Integrals

Section simple_fun_raw_integral.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.
Variables (T : Type) (R : numDomainType) (mu : set T ‚Üí \bar R) (f : T ‚Üí R).

Definition sintegral := \sum_(x \in [set: R]) x%:E √ó mu (f @^-1` [set x]).

Lemma sintegralET :
  sintegral = \sum_(x \in [set: R]) x%:E √ó mu (f @^-1` [set x]).

End simple_fun_raw_integral.

  solve [apply: measure_ge0] : core.

Section integral.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.

  h in [set h : {nnsfun T >-> R} | ‚àÄ x, (h x)%:E ‚â§ f x]].

  nnintegral (EFin \o h) = sintegral mu h.

  nnintegral (g ^\+) - nnintegral (g ^\-).

  \int_(x in D) f x = \int_(x in D) g x.

Lemma ge0_integralE D f : (‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ f x) ‚Üí
  \int_(x in D) f x = nnintegral (f \_ D).

  \int_(x in setT) f x = nnintegral f.

  \int_(x in D) f x = \int_(x in D) (f ^\+ x) - \int_(x in D) f ^\- x.

Lemma integral0 D : \int_(x in D) (cst 0 x) = 0.

Lemma integral_ge0 D f : (‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ f x) ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ \int_(x in D) f x.

  \int_(x in D) (h x)%:E = sintegral mu (h \_ D).

End integral.

Section approximation.
Variables (T : measurableType) (R : realType) (D : set T) (mD : measurable D).
Variables (f : T ‚Üí \bar R) (mf : measurable_fun D f).


Let A n k := if (k < n √ó 2 ^ n)%N then
  D `&` [set x | f x \in EFin @` [set` I n k]] else set0.

Let B n := D `&` [set x | n%:R%:E ‚â§ f x]%E.

Definition approx : (T ‚Üí R)^nat := fun n x ‚áí
  \sum_(k < n √ó 2 ^ n) k%:R √ó 2 ^- n √ó (x \in A n k)%:R +
  n%:R √ó (x \in B n)%:R.

technical properties of the sets A and B
Let mA n k : measurable (A n k).

Let trivIsetA n : trivIset setT (A n).

Let f0_A0 n (i : 'I_(n √ó 2 ^ n)) x : f x = 0%:E ‚Üí i != O :> nat ‚Üí
  x \in A n i = false.

Let fgen_A0 n x (i : 'I_(n √ó 2 ^ n)) : (n%:R%:E ‚â§ f x)%E ‚Üí
  x \in A n i = false.

Let disj_A0 x n (i k : 'I_(n √ó 2 ^ n)) : i != k ‚Üí
  x \in A n k ‚Üí (x \in A n i) = false.
Arguments disj_A0 {x n i} k.

Let mB n : measurable (B n).

Let foo_B1 x n : D x ‚Üí f x = +oo%E ‚Üí x \in B n.

Let f0_B0 x n : f x = 0%:E ‚Üí n != 0%N ‚Üí (x \in B n) = false.

Let fgtn_B0 x n : (f x < n%:R%:E)%E ‚Üí (x \in B n) = false.

Let f0_approx0 n x : f x = 0%E ‚Üí approx n x = 0.

Let fpos_approx_neq0 x : D x ‚Üí (0%E < f x < +oo)%E ‚Üí
  \‚àÄ n \near \oo, approx n x != 0.

Let f_ub_approx n x : (f x < n%:R%:E)%E ‚Üí
  approx n x == 0 ‚à® ‚àÉ k,
    [/\ (0 < k < n √ó 2 ^ n)%N,
       x \in A n k, approx n x = k%:R / 2 ^+ n &
       f x \in EFin @` [set` I n k]].

Let notinD_A0 x n k : ¬¨ D x ‚Üí (x \in A n k) = false.

Let notinD_B0 x n : ¬¨ D x ‚Üí (x \in B n) = false.

Lemma nd_approx : nondecreasing_seq approx.

Lemma cvg_approx x (f0 : ‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí (0 ‚â§ f x)%E) : D x ‚Üí
  (f x < +oo)%E ‚Üí (approx^~ x) --> fine (f x).

Lemma le_approx k x (f0 : ‚àÄ x, (0 ‚â§ f x)%E) : D x ‚Üí
  ((approx k x)%:E ‚â§ f x)%E.

Lemma dvg_approx x : D x ‚Üí f x = +oo%E ‚Üí ¬¨ cvg (approx^~ x : _ ‚Üí R^o).

Lemma ecvg_approx (f0 : ‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí (0 ‚â§ f x)%E) x :
  D x ‚Üí EFin \o approx^~x --> f x.

Let k2n_ge0 n (k : 'I_(n √ó 2 ^ n)) : 0 ‚â§ k%:R √ó 2 ^- n :> R.

Definition nnsfun_approx : {nnsfun T >-> R}^nat := fun n ‚áí locked (add_nnsfun
  (sum_nnsfun
    (fun k ‚áí match Bool.bool_dec (k < (n √ó 2 ^ n))%N true with
      | left h ‚áí scale_nnsfun (indic_nnsfun _ (mA n k)) (k2n_ge0 (Ordinal h))
      | right _ ‚áí nnsfun0
     end) (n √ó 2 ^ n)%N)
  (scale_nnsfun (indic_nnsfun _ (mB n)) (ler0n _ n))).

Lemma nnsfun_approxE n : nnsfun_approx n = approx n :> (T ‚Üí R).

Lemma cvg_nnsfun_approx (f0 : ‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí (0 ‚â§ f x)%E) x :
  D x ‚Üí EFin \o nnsfun_approx^~x --> f x.

Lemma nd_nnsfun_approx : nondecreasing_seq (nnsfun_approx : (T ‚Üí R)^nat).

Lemma approximation : (‚àÄ t, D t ‚Üí (0 ‚â§ f t)%E) ‚Üí
  ‚àÉ g : {nnsfun T >-> R}^nat, nondecreasing_seq (g : (T ‚Üí R)^nat) ‚àß
                        (‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí EFin \o g^~x --> f x).

End approximation.

Section integralN.

  \int[mu]_(x in D) f^\+ x +? (- \int[mu]_(x in D) f^\- x) ‚Üí
  \int[mu]_(x in D) - f x = - \int[mu]_(x in D) f x.

Lemma integral_ge0N (D : set T) (f : T ‚Üí \bar R) :
  (‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ f x) ‚Üí
  \int[mu]_(x in D) - f x = - \int[mu]_(x in D) f x.

End integralN.

Section subset_integral.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.
Variables (T : measurableType) (R : realType) (mu : {measure set T ‚Üí \bar R}).

Lemma integral_setU (A B : set T) (mA : measurable A) (mB : measurable B)
    (f : T ‚Üí \bar R) : measurable_fun (A `|` B) f ‚Üí
  (‚àÄ x, (A `|` B) x ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ f x) ‚Üí [disjoint A & B] ‚Üí
  \int[mu]_(x in A `|` B) f x = \int[mu]_(x in A) f x + \int[mu]_(x in B) f x.

Lemma subset_integral (A B : set T) (mA : measurable A) (mB : measurable B)
    (f : T ‚Üí \bar R) : measurable_fun B f ‚Üí (‚àÄ x, B x ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ f x) ‚Üí
  A `<=` B ‚Üí \int[mu]_(x in A) f x ‚â§ \int[mu]_(x in B) f x.

Lemma integral_set0 (f : T ‚Üí \bar R) : \int[mu]_(x in set0) f x = 0.

Lemma ge0_integral_bigsetU (F : (set T)^nat) (f : T ‚Üí \bar R) n :
  (‚àÄ n, measurable (F n)) ‚Üí
  let D := \big[setU/set0]_(i < n) F i in
  measurable_fun D f ‚Üí
  (‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí 0 ‚â§ f x) ‚Üí
  trivIset `I_n F ‚Üí
  \int[mu]_(x in D) f x = \sum_(i < n) \int[mu]_(x in F i) f x.

Lemma le_integral_abse (D : set T) (mD : measurable D) (g : T ‚Üí \bar R) a :
  measurable_fun D g ‚Üí (0 < a)%R ‚Üí
  a%:E √ó mu (D `&` [set x | (`|g x| ‚â• a%:E)%E]) ‚â§ \int[mu]_(x in D) `|g x|.

End subset_integral.

Section integrable.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.
Variables (T : measurableType) (R : realType) (mu : {measure set T ‚Üí \bar R}).
Variables (D : set T) (mD : measurable D).
Implicit Type f : T ‚Üí \bar R.

Definition integrable f :=
  measurable_fun D f ‚àß (\int[mu]_(x in D) `|f x| < +oo).

Lemma eq_integrable f1 f2 : {in D, f1 =1 f2} ‚Üí
  integrable f1 ‚Üí integrable f2.

Lemma le_integrable f1 f2 : measurable_fun D f1 ‚Üí
  (‚àÄ x, D x ‚Üí `|f1 x| ‚â§ `|f2 x|) ‚Üí integrable f2 ‚Üí integrable f1.

Lemma integrableN f : integrable f ‚Üí integrable (-%E \o f).

Lemma integrableK (k : R) f : integrable f ‚Üí integrable (fun x ‚áí k%:E √ó f x).

Lemma integrableD f1 f2 : integrable f1 ‚Üí integrable f2 ‚Üí integrable (f1 \+ f2).

Lemma integrableB f1 f2 : integrable f1 ‚Üí integrable f2 ‚Üí
  integrable (f1 \- f2).

Lemma integrable_add_def f : integrable f ‚Üí
  \int[mu]_(x in D) f^\+ x +? - \int[mu]_(x in D) f^\- x.

Lemma integrable_funepos f : integrable f ‚Üí integrable f^\+.

Lemma integrable_funeneg f : integrable f ‚Üí integrable f^\-.

Lemma integral_funeneg_lt_pinfty f : integrable f ‚Üí
  \int[mu]_(x in D) f^\- x < +oo.

Lemma integral_funepos_lt_pinfty f : integrable f ‚Üí
  \int[mu]_(x in D) f^\+ x < +oo.

End integrable.
Notation "mu .-integrable" := (integrable mu) : type_scope.

Section dominated_convergence_lemma.

Section dominated_convergence_theorem.

Theorem dominated_convergence : [/\ mu.-integrable D f,
  (fun n ‚áí \int[mu]_(x in D) (g_ n x) ) --> 0 &
  (fun n ‚áí \int[mu]_(x in D) (f_ n x) ) --> \int[mu]_(x in D) (f x) ].

End dominated_convergence_theorem.

Lemma product_measure1E (A1 : set T1) (A2 : set T2) :
  measurable A1 ‚Üí measurable A2 ‚Üí
  product_measure1 m1 sm2 (A1 `*` A2) = m1 A1 √ó m2 A2.

End product_measure1E.

Section fubini.
Local Open Scope ereal_scope.
Variables (T1 T2 : measurableType) (R : realType).
Variables (m1 : {measure set T1 ‚Üí \bar R}) (m2 : {measure set T2 ‚Üí \bar R}).
Hypotheses (sf_m1 : sigma_finite setT m1) (sf_m2 : sigma_finite setT m2).
Variable f : T1 √ó T2 ‚Üí \bar R.
Hypothesis mf : measurable_fun setT f.

Let m : {measure set (T1 √ó T2) ‚Üí \bar R} := product_measure1 m1 sf_m2.

Lemma fubini1a :
  m.-integrable setT f ‚Üî \int[m1]_x \int[m2]_y `|f (x, y)| < +oo.

Lemma fubini1b :
  m.-integrable setT f ‚Üî \int[m2]_y \int[m1]_x `|f (x, y)| < +oo.

Let measurable_fun1 : measurable_fun setT (fun x ‚áí \int[m2]_y `|f (x, y)|).

Let measurable_fun2 : measurable_fun setT (fun y ‚áí \int[m1]_x `|f (x, y)|).

Hypothesis imf : m.-integrable setT f.

Lemma ae_integrable1 :
  {ae m1, ‚àÄ x, m2.-integrable setT (fun y ‚áí f (x, y))}.

Lemma ae_integrable2 :
  {ae m2, ‚àÄ y, m1.-integrable setT (fun x ‚áí f (x, y))}.

Let F := fubini_F m2 f.

Let Fplus x := \int[m2]_y f^\+ (x, y).
Let Fminus x := \int[m2]_y f^\- (x, y).

Let FE : F = Fplus \- Fminus.

Let measurable_Fplus : measurable_fun setT Fplus.

Let measurable_Fminus : measurable_fun setT Fminus.

Lemma measurable_fubini_F : measurable_fun setT F.

Let integrable_Fplus : m1.-integrable setT Fplus.

Let integrable_Fminus : m1.-integrable setT Fminus.

Lemma integrable_fubini_F : m1.-integrable setT F.

Let G := fubini_G m1 f.

Let Gplus y := \int[m1]_x f^\+ (x, y).
Let Gminus y := \int[m1]_x f^\- (x, y).

Let GE : G = Gplus \- Gminus.

Let measurable_Gplus : measurable_fun setT Gplus.

Let measurable_Gminus : measurable_fun setT Gminus.

Lemma measurable_fubini_G : measurable_fun setT G.

Let integrable_Gplus : m2.-integrable setT Gplus.

Let integrable_Gminus : m2.-integrable setT Gminus.

Lemma fubini1 : \int[m1]_x F x = \int[m]_z f z.

Lemma fubini2 : \int[m2]_x G x = \int[m]_z f z.

Theorem Fubini :
  \int[m1]_x \int[m2]_y f (x, y) = \int[m2]_y \int[m1]_x f (x, y).

End fubini.
